entry.title: help learning basics
entry.content:
**NOTE**: Changing the template (or component which causes a template change) may change the access level this bug defaults to and it may no longer be confidential.
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) (2) (3)
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: My apps outside of Google sponsored apps aren't working. Why? What's restricting
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Only play store, play system, and google featured apps are running 2. I see play system and chrome showing cach background 3. My google.com server is being blocked. Please allow so I can receive messages. I'm not sure if cloudflare or aws is restricting
# Problem Description Suddenly, I'm not able to receive web message to my device. My WiFi connection is Xfinity. Why wouldn't I be receiving messages if connection shows excellent. I only utilize Google voice as my main phone number. Please allow my 8888 and 8844 capabilities
Events Proxy DNS Sockets Domain Security Policy Shared Dictionaries HSTS/PKP HSTS is HTTP Strict Transport Security: a way for sites to elect to always use HTTPS. See https://www.chromium.org/hsts. PKP is Public Key Pinning: Chrome "pins" certain public keys for certain sites in official builds. Add HSTS domain Input a domain name to add it to the HSTS set:
Domain: example.com Include subdomains for STS: Query HSTS/PKP domain Input a domain name to query the current HSTS/PKP set:
Domain: www.google.com
Found: static_sts_domain: static_upgrade_mode: DEFAULT static_sts_include_subdomains: false static_sts_observed: 0 static_pkp_domain: static_pkp_include_subdomains: static_pkp_observed: static_spki_hashes: dynamic_sts_domain: www.google.com dynamic_upgrade_mode: FORCE_HTTPS dynamic_sts_include_subdomains: false dynamic_sts_observed: 1713739400.682229 dynamic_sts_expiry: 1800139400.682036 static_sts_domain: static_upgrade_mode: DEFAULT static_sts_include_subdomains: false static_sts_observed: 0 static_pkp_domain: static_pkp_include_subdomains: static_pkp_observed: static_spki_hashes: dynamic_sts_domain: www.google.com dynamic_upgrade_mode: FORCE_HTTPS dynamic_sts_include_subdomains: false dynamic_sts_observed: 1713739400.682229 dynamic_sts_expiry: 1800139400.682036 static_sts_domain: static_upgrade_mode: DEFAULT static_sts_include_subdomains: false static_sts_observed: 0 static_pkp_domain: google.com static_pkp_include_subdomains: true static_pkp_observed: 1713012928 static_spki_hashes: sha256/IPMbDAjLVSGntGO3WP53X/zilCVndez5YJ2+vJvhJsA=,sha256/hxqRlPTu1bMS/0DITB1SSu0vd4u/8l8TjPgfaAp63Gc=,sha256/Vfd95BwDeSQo+NUYxVEEIlvkOlWY2SalKK1lPhzOx78=,sha256/QXnt2YHvdHR3tJYmQIr0Paosp6t/nggsEGD4QJZ3Q0g=,sha256/mEflZT5enoR1FuXLgYYGqnVEoZvmf9c2bVBpiOjYQ0c=,sha256/CLOmM1/OXvSPjw5UOYbAf9GKOxImEp9hhku9W90fHMk= dynamic_sts_domain: www.google.com dynamic_upgrade_mode: FORCE_HTTPS dynamic_sts_include_subdomains: false dynamic_sts_observed: 1713739400.682229 dynamic_sts_expiry: 1800139400.682036
# Additional Comments Please open my ports and remove any app restrictions.
# Summary My apps outside of Google sponsored apps aren't working. Why? What's restricting
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Autofill does not work, popup appears with autofil details but not able to select/tap
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Login via Chrome to any website 2. On website select box to type login 3. When selecting popup appears Google password manager with the suggested login details 4. Want to proceed to select the login details by tapping on it nothing happens, unable to select the autofill details as per usual 5. Clicking away the screen autofill still shows in small bar above keyboard, still unable to select anything 6. Same applies when wanting to use autofill option to fill out a form with my personal details
# Problem Description Using a Samsung S21 a few days ago my autofill stopped working in chrome, by stopped working I mean the suggested login or autofill details popup but I am unable to tap on it/select it, needless to say this is very annoying because I use this function a lot. When using Ssung internet browser it seems to be working but it is not my preferred browser.
I have been searching for solution but I am unable to find any. What I have tried so far;
- Checking my setting for autofill / passwords these are correctly set for google - In the apps overview cleared caches for both chrome and samsung password - Reset chrome, uninstall & reinstall Chrome - Classic rebooting the phone multiple times - Making sure everything is up to date
# Additional Comments As shown in screenshots the correct details appear to login but unable to select anything.
# Summary Autofill does not work, popup appears with autofil details but not able to select/tap
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Can no longer connect Chromebook to Moto G Fast phone after ChromeOS update.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. On Chromebook, Settings > Connected Devices shows "Android phone: No eligible devices" 2. This was working prior to ChromeOS update.
There's a chance I inadvertently changed a setting to cause this, but I can't find it.
# Problem Description Lenovo TB125FU Chromebook was connected successfully to Moto G Fast phone. This stopped working after the ChromeOS update was applied. Powerwash didn't fix problem. Forcing CryptAuth enrollment didn't fix problem. In ProximityAuth CRYPTAUTH box, ENROLLMENT is fresh with current date/time. The words "DEVICE SYNC" are red and "Last success" = "Never synced".
# Additional Comments ProximityAuth screenshot and log are attached.
# Summary Can no longer connect Chromebook to Moto G Fast phone after ChromeOS update.
# Additional Data Category: Sync \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: cast_auth_util_fuzzer: Null-dereference READ in cast_certificate::CastTrustStore::AddDefaultCertificates
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5913339268890624
Fuzzing Engine: centipede Fuzz Target: cast_auth_util_fuzzer Job Type: centipede_chrome_asan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Null-dereference READ Crash Address: 0x000000000020 Crash State: cast_certificate::CastTrustStore::AddDefaultCertificates cast_certificate::CastTrustStore::AccessInstance cast_certificate::VerifyDeviceCert
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=centipede_chrome_asan&range=1290231:1290253
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5913339268890624
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Feature Request: Bookmark Tags
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Users saves a bookmark 2. Users are presented with the bookmark modal to customize name, choose folder, and add tags 3. When user enters cursor into the tags box, smart suggestions suggest the most recently used and common tags, e.g. "read later" 4. If the user provides ultimate tags they may start typing a custom tag name 5. Autocomplete will conduct a case-sensitive search and suggest tags containing similar words to prevent duplicates 6. If no duplicates are found, the custom tag is added to the tag database 7. User is able to add multiple tags by separating tag entries with a semicolon 7. Tags are indexed for optimized searching
# Problem Description As a user, I require the ability to, in addition to choosing which folder to save the bookmark in, apply tag (metadata) to more easily categorize tags that may belong in multiple folders, and improve bookmark search and filtering capabilities.
# Additional Comments I use Chrome for work use, but still primarily use Firefox for personal use because Chrome lacks this feature.
# Summary Feature Request: Bookmark Tags
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: ANGULAR SELECT FIELD CRASHING ON LATEST CHROME UPDATE
entry.content:
My users are complaining on the crashing of the entire browser (Snap, Error Code: 11) after they updated Chrome to latest release.
Steps to reproduce: - Angular Framework - Mat Select Field - On Clock into the list (to show the list of selections) - Whole tab will crash

entry.title: The new bookmark added a pop-up is a BAD experience for the user.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Click Add URL to save bookmarks 2. move the cursor 3. click to edit the title of the bookmark or click to remove if you add the wrong bookmark
# Problem Description The new bookmark-added pop-up is very BAD. In the old pop-up, I could edit the title, change the save bookmark folder, or delete the folder immediately with just the tab key. Now, I must move the mouse and click edit to edit the bookmark name or change the folder name.
It takes a lot of steps if usually save the bookmark.
# Summary The new bookmark added a pop-up is a BAD experience for the user.
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Null-dereference READ in blink::AXObject::IsMissingParent
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5928451983736832
Fuzzer: marty_html_twiddler Job Type: linux_asan_content_shell_drt Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Null-dereference READ Crash Address: 0x000000000000 Crash State: blink::AXObject::IsMissingParent blink::AXObject::ParentObject blink::AXObject::SetAncestorsHaveDirtyDescendants
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_content_shell_drt&range=1289970:1289981
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5928451983736832
Additional requirements: Requires Gestures
Issue filed automatically.
To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary.
If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.
If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5 so we can improve.

entry.title: Chrome Bookmarks jumps itself to the top after deleting one.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. First, you need to have enough bookmarks to scroll 2. Select the last bookmark. Then delete or move this bookmark to another folder 3. After deleting a bookmark, the bookmarks will automatically scroll to the top
# Problem Description My bookmarks it jumps to the top of my bookmarks every time I delete a bookmark. This problem has been happening for a long time but why haven't you fixed this error yet, I had this problem 6-9 months ago. But after many updates, it's still the same.
# Additional Comments This is my video demo this bug https://youtu.be/mC-aR1wpWqY
# Summary Chrome Bookmarks jumps itself to the top after deleting one.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Chromium-based programs segfault when attempting to drag any content anywhere
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Click and hold to drag content (e.g. selected text)
# Problem Description Chromium and any derivations (e.g. all Electron apps) crash after attempting to drag any content.
Upon running the core dump with `coredumpctl`, the problem reveals itself to be a segmentation fault which (I think) originates in a call to `PostTaskAndReplyRelay`. The relevant backtrace from gdb can be found below:
``` #0 0x00007b30fa3e1b05 in scratch_buffer_init (buffer=0x7b30e9c00ed0) at ../include/scratch_buffer.h:78 #1 __GI___realpath (name=0x7b30e9c02c90 "/usr/share/icons", resolved=0x7b30e9c01bb0 '\252' <repeats 200 times>...) at canonicalize.c:428 #2 0x00005bdd534000ed in base::MakeAbsoluteFilePath(base::FilePath const&) () #3 0x00005bdd5485837f in ui::(anonymous namespace)::ReadCursorFromTheme(std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&) () #4 0x00005bdd54858b1f in ui::(anonymous namespace)::ReadCursorFromTheme(std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&) ()
...
#19383 0x00005bdd54858b1f in ui::(anonymous namespace)::ReadCursorFromTheme(std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&) () #19384 0x00005bdd5485645d in ui::(anonymous namespace)::ReadCursorImages(std::__Cr::vector<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> >, std::__Cr::allocator<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > > > const&, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&, unsigned int) [clone .1f2f351917f287266377810b9716c050] () #19385 0x00005bdd5485811a in base::internal::Invoker<base::internal::FunctorTraits<std::__Cr::vector<ui::XCursorLoader::Image, std::__Cr::allocator<ui::XCursorLoader::Image> > (*&&)(std::__Cr::vector<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> >, std::__Cr::allocator<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > > > const&, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&, unsigned int), std::__Cr::vector<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> >, std::__Cr::allocator<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > > >&&, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> >&&, unsigned int&&>, base::internal::BindState<false, true, false, std::__Cr::vector<ui::XCursorLoader::Image, std::__Cr::allocator<ui::XCursorLoader::Image> > (*)(std::__Cr::vector<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> >, std::__Cr::allocator<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > > > const&, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const&, unsigned int), std::__Cr::vector<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> >, std::__Cr::allocator<std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> > > >, std::__Cr::basic_string<char, std::__Cr::char_traits<char>, std::__Cr::allocator<char> >, unsigned int>, std::__Cr::vector<ui::XCursorLoader::Image, std::__Cr::allocator<ui::XCursorLoader::Image> > ()>::RunOnce(base::internal::BindStateBase*) [clone .cfi] () #19386 0x00005bdd548590d7 in void base::internal::ReturnAsParamAdapter<std::__Cr::vector<ui::XCursorLoader::Image, std::__Cr::allocator<ui::XCursorLoader::Image> > >(base::OnceCallback<std::__Cr::vector<ui::XCursorLoader::Image, std::__Cr::allocator<ui::XCursorLoader::Image> > ()>, std::__Cr::unique_ptr<std::__Cr::vector<ui::XCursorLoader::Image, std::__Cr::allocator<ui::XCursorLoader::Image> >, std::__Cr::default_delete<std::__Cr::vector<ui::XCursorLoader::Image, std::__Cr::allocator<ui::XCursorLoader::Image> > > >*) () #19387 0x00005bdd533ae597 in base::internal::PostTaskAndReplyRelay::RunT ```
# Additional Comments I'm running on x86_64 Arch Linux with the GNOME desktop environment under Xorg.
# Summary Chromium-based programs segfault when attempting to drag any content anywhere
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? The whole browser
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Unintended inconvenience of enabling the link preview feature
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem I disabled the ability to open the link in a popup layer window when alt-mouse over the link by flagging it, but now it seems to be a default feature that I can't disable.
I never use this feature intentionally, and it seems to be more of an accidental trigger when combining hotkeys.
It seems like it should either support disabling it, or support changing the shortcut.
# Problem Description Features pop up arbitrarily and against the user's intention
# Summary Unintended inconvenience of enabling the link preview feature
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Dev \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Upstream chromium fails to build on Windows as generated binaries crashing with exit code 3221225477
entry.content:
The culprit is this commit: [PA] Fix exit-time constructor in freelist dispatcher https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5454331
Was able to easily reproduce on windows: ``` gn gen out\Default --args="is_component_build=false is_official_build=true is_debug=false" autoninja -C out\Default components/url_formatter/spoof_checks/top_domains:generate_top_domains_trie ```
Fails with: ``` [525/526] ACTION //components/url_formatter/spoof_checks/t...rate_top_domains_trie(//build/toolchain/win:win_clang_x64) FAILED: gen/components/url_formatter/spoof_checks/top_domains/domains-trie-inc.cc C:/depot_tools/bootstrap-2@3_8_10_chromium_23_bin/python3/bin/python3.exe ../../build/gn_run_binary.py top_domain_generator.exe ../../components/url_formatter/spoof_checks/top_domains/domains.skeletons ../../components/url_formatter/spoof_checks/top_domains/top_domains_trie.template gen/components/url_formatter/spoof_checks/top_domains/domains-trie-inc.cc top_domain_generator.exe failed with exit code 3221225477 ```
Crashing callstack: ``` ntdll.dll!RtlpEnterCriticalSectionContended() Unknown ntdll.dll!RtlEnterCriticalSection() Unknown [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!_Init_thread_lock() Line 134 C++ top_domain_generator.exe!_Init_thread_header(int * pOnce) Line 198 C++ > [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::internal::PartitionFreelistDispatcher::Create(partition_alloc::internal::PartitionFreelistEncoding encoding) Line 302 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::PartitionRoot::get_freelist_dispatcher() Line 905 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::internal::PartitionBucket::ProvisionMoreSlotsAndAllocOne(partition_alloc::PartitionRoot * root, partition_alloc::internal::AllocFlags flags, partition_alloc::internal::SlotSpanMetadata * slot_span) Line 980 C++ top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::internal::PartitionBucket::SlowPathAlloc(partition_alloc::PartitionRoot * root, partition_alloc::internal::AllocFlags flags, unsigned __int64 raw_size, unsigned __int64 slot_span_alignment, partition_alloc::internal::SlotSpanMetadata * * slot_span, bool * is_already_zeroed) Line 1477 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::PartitionRoot::AllocFromBucket(partition_alloc::internal::PartitionBucket * bucket, unsigned __int64 raw_size, unsigned __int64 slot_span_alignment, unsigned __int64 * usable_size, unsigned __int64 * slot_size, bool * is_already_zeroed) Line 1294 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::PartitionRoot::RawAlloc(partition_alloc::internal::PartitionBucket * bucket, unsigned __int64 raw_size, unsigned __int64 slot_span_alignment, unsigned __int64 * usable_size, unsigned __int64 * slot_size, bool * is_already_zeroed) Line 2316 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::PartitionRoot::AllocInternalNoHooks(unsigned __int64 requested_size, unsigned __int64 slot_span_alignment) Line 2197 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::PartitionRoot::AllocInternal(unsigned __int64 requested_size, unsigned __int64 slot_span_alignment, const char * type_name) Line 2104 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!partition_alloc::PartitionRoot::AllocInline(unsigned __int64 requested_size, const char * type_name) Line 511 C++ top_domain_generator.exe!allocator_shim::internal::PartitionCalloc(const allocator_shim::AllocatorDispatch *, unsigned __int64 n, unsigned __int64 size, void * context) Line 225 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!ShimCalloc(unsigned __int64 n, unsigned __int64 size, void * context) Line 119 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!calloc(unsigned __int64 n, unsigned __int64 size) Line 100 C++ top_domain_generator.exe!_calloc_base(unsigned __int64 n, unsigned __int64 size) Line 100 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!internal_get_ptd_head() Line 244 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!internal_getptd_noexit(const __crt_scoped_get_last_error_reset &) Line 271 C++ [Inline Frame] top_domain_generator.exe!internal_getptd_noexit() Line 283 C++ top_domain_generator.exe!__acrt_getptd_noexit() Line 295 C++ top_domain_generator.exe!__acrt_initialize_ptd() Line 36 C++ top_domain_generator.exe!__acrt_execute_initializers(const __acrt_initializer * first, const __acrt_initializer * last) Line 25 C++ ```
Was able to reproduce on multiple Windows machine. Reverting that commit fixes the issue. It seems that changing to `base::NoDestructor` caused a circular initialization dependency between CRT and PA. (found a reference to a similar issue that wasn't merged in the slack channel)

entry.title: Profile Symbol is having double times
entry.content:
Chrome Version:126.0.6430.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) f154b085597a651ddcc9658d11fff3ace3e4737e-refs/branch-heads/6430@{#1}
OS : Win(10,11)
Preconditions: Disable #side-panel-pinning flag from (chrome://flags)
Steps to reproduce: 1.Launch Chrome and Open NTP 2.Search anything(Ex: facebook) 3.Now click on Side panel present at top right in Omnibox 4Now Click on Drop down and then on Search 5.Observe that, Profile icon is having doop to original
Actual Result: Profile icon is having double times Expected Result:Profile icon should be original
This issue exists from M-121 Onwards. So, raising it as a NR issue.
Please refer to the Attached Screencast below: https://somup.com/cZfrjrCPSf
Notes: 1)This issue able to repro on Stable RC #124.0.6367.54 , Beta RC #125.0.6422.3 and Dev RC#126.0.6423.0 2)As this being a Non-Regression issue,changing the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Thanks..!!

entry.title: light-dark() CSS function is not working correctly when using <use> with an SVG in a .svg file
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Define an SVG using light-dark in the <style> e.g. <svg id="icon" viewBox="0 0 416 416" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"> <style> path { stroke: light-dark(red, green); } </style> <path d="M400 208C400 102 314 16 208 16C102 16 16 102 16 208C16 314 102 400 208 400C314 400 400 314 400 208Z" stroke="blue" stroke-width="32" stroke-miterlimit="10"/> <path d="M208 128V288M288 208H128" stroke="blue" stroke-width="32" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"/> </svg> 2. Set <meta name="color-scheme" content="dark light"> in the head of the HTML 3. Use the icon in your HTML e.g. <svg><use href="add-circle-outline.svg#icon"></use></svg> 4. Toggle between light and dark mode
# Problem Description When you use a <symbol> inline in HTML and then <use> it, light-dark() function works as expected. When the symbol is in an .svg file, it does not work.
# Summary light-dark() CSS function is not working correctly when using <use> with an SVG in a .svg file
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>SVG
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue It works correctly in Firefox. The issue is the same in Safari Technology Preview
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: [Extensions API] The chrome.windows.Window.alwaysOnTop property is always false
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/releases/tag/v0.80.1 2. Download and install PowerToysUserSetup-0.80.1-x64.exe 3. Open the PowerToys Settings and enable "Always On Top" (see attached screenshot) 4. Download and uncompress the attached extension package 5. Go to chrome://extensions, enable developer mode and install the unpacked extension 6. In the extension details, next to "Inspect view", click on "service worker" and select the "Console" panel 7. Press Win + Ctrl + T. This will make the DevTools window to be always on top. 8. Click on the extension's toolbar icon. A log message will appear in the DevTools console.
# Problem Description The chrome.windows.Window.alwaysOnTop property does not reflect the true alwaysOnTop state of any Chrome window.
EXPECTED RESULT: Each time the extension's toolbar icon is clicked, the DevTools console should show the message "alwaysOnTop windows: 1". Which should indicate the amount of windows with the alwaysOnTop state enabled.
ACTUAL RESULT: The message in the console is always "alwaysOnTop windows: 0", which means the Window.alwaysOnTop property is always false.
# Summary [Extensions API] The chrome.windows.Window.alwaysOnTop property is always false
# Custom Questions #### What kind of software had the problem? Chrome Extension - Adds new browser functionality
# Additional Data Category: Extensions / Themes \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: printpreview is hanging and is taking long time to load
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open any web page 2. try to print the web page (using CTRL-P, or ALT-F then P, or right-click then "print") 3.
# Problem Description Three problems: 1. "Loading preview ..." message takes much longer than normal to load. The three dots continue bouncing while the "Loading preview ..." message is displayed, so the page/view is not fully hung, but it does take much longer than normal to load. 2. Selecting fields to change print settings values (Scale %, Pages, Layout, etc.) does not respond for many seconds. 3. Clicking "cancel" button (instead of "print button") does not respond for many seconds. This is a MAJOR productivity killer. I can't get anything done anymore because I spend half my day waiting for chrome to respond when I try to print something to PDF. It appears that this problem (or one very similar) has been reported previously, for earlier versions of chrome/chromium. If that is correct, it seems reasonable to wonder if the same (or simillar) coding defects keep getting re-introduced? If that is the case, it is very frustrating that such an impactful error keeps getting reintroduced over and over again but does NOT get fixed in a timely manner.
# Summary printpreview is hanging and is taking long time to load
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Chromium Wayland/Linux backend should use wp_fractional_scale_v1 preferred_scale event for the scale factor
entry.content:
The Chromium Linux Wayland backend incorrectly calculates the scale factor by dividing the physical and logical size of the output. This results in rounding issues and a blurred interface due to inconsistencies between the submitted client surface and the expected compositor surface sizes.
However, Mutter and Sway have a bug: even when client correctly using the preferred_scale event value, it still leads to blurriness, despite being the exact scale factor provided by the compositor. In fact, calculating the scale factor using the physical/logical method results in a crisp interface under GNOME and Sway, but blurred in KDE. KWin honestly provides the scaling factor to the clients and uses it for compositing, but Mutter and wlroots do not. These are separate bugs in these compositors.
https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/wayland/wayland-protocols/-/blob/main/staging/fractional-scale/fractional-scale-v1.xml

entry.title: Only google owned sites will load. All else, ERR_TIMED_OUT
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome or Edge 2. Wait for page to load 3. Get "URL" took too long to respond. ERR_TIMED_OUT
# Problem Description Starting approximately 4/18/24, Chromium based browsers will only load Google owned web sites at my place of work. (google.com, youtube.com, wase.com, calicolabs.com, etc.) Initially, this was only happening on ethernet connections, but switching to WiFi fixed the problem. Now I am seeing some computers that do not work on either. Initially, I was working fine, then MS Edge prompted me to relaunch following an update and after that neither Edge or Chrome worked over ethernet. Other web based applications work fine (MS Outlook, Teams, FireFox). Uninstall/reinstall did not work. I have tried checking browser cache, firewall, DNS, Windows updates, etc. but nothing has corrected the issue. Chrome is at version 124.0.6367.61 and Edge is 124.0.2478.51. My OS is Windows 10. Both browsers give ERR_TIMED_OUT message after a short period of trying to load the page.
# Additional Comments I have tried dozens of sites to the same effect.
# Summary Only google owned sites will load. All else, ERR_TIMED_OUT
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: www.cnn.com
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Inconsistent MIME type expectation for imported module without import assertions.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. load an ESM script which imports another module with ".json" extension: "import file from "./file.json";" 2. Change the response header on the server to "text/javascript" and prepend the payload with "export default" to satisfy the browser's MIME type expectation. 3. Witness an inconsistent new error which complains it was indeed expecting an "application/json" MIME type for the same unmodified import on the client-side.
# Problem Description Importing a module that will return content-type:"application/json" header without import assertions will, correctly, throw an error because the browser expects "text/javascript" MIME type by default. Import assertions have been introduced because the file extension, correctly, shouldn't be relied on to indicate a different MIME type. Yet when, in choosing to adhere with the MIME type expectation by the server side instead of opting in to this new, and therefore backwards incompatible and potentially still debatable static import assertion syntax - without any reasonable defaults beyond what ".js" files are contrarily privileged with -, by returning "text/javascript" MIME type and prepending "export default" to the json payload (under the condition of request.headers["sec-fetch-dest"] being "script" and the request.url extensioin being ".json"), the browser now suddenly changes its mind and tells it expected "application/json" MIME type, actually. How is the MIME type expectation so inconsistent for a module which is supposed to not care about the file extension and default to "text/javascript", unless an import assertion specifies otherwise, at least since they were introduced?
# Additional Comments screenshots attached with error messages returned by an unmodified client side script, only receiving either a "text/javascript" ot "application/json" response MIME type, respectively.
# Summary Inconsistent MIME type expectation for imported module without import assertions.
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes
